meanings.definition: A metal ring or cap used to strengthen or secure the end of a handle or tube.
meanings.sent1: The ferruling on the tool handle kept it sturdy.
meanings.sent2: She carefully slid the ferruling onto the tube to reinforce it.
meanings.sent3: The ferruling decided to throw a party for all the other tool parts.
meanings.sent4: The ferruling was like a knight's armor, protecting the handle.
meanings.sent5: The shiny ferruling gleamed in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.

meanings.definition: To fit a ferrule onto the end of a handle or tube.
meanings.sent1: He was ferruling the handle to make it more durable.
meanings.sent2: They ferruled the tube securely in place.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was ferruling acorns into its hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: She was ferruling her thoughts together before the big presentation.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic deftly ferruled the new handle onto the tool, completing the repair.
